We will update the packets on Monday of each week. Please click on the link below to view and print the weekly packets.

Stanfield School District had already announced grading practices that align with the state’s recommendations. div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: On Monday, April 13th, Stanfield School District will be implementing our Distance Learning for ALL plan. Under the Supplemental Learning tab on the website, students and parents will be able to find copies of the week's packets for all grade levels. These packets will be delivered by bus each Monday for the rest of the school year. Parents and students can also pick up a copy of the grade-level packets at Bard Park every Monday between 11am and noon.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: On Wednesday, April 8th, Governor Kate Brown closed schools for the remainder of the 2019-20 academic year as part of the social distancing efforts related to the COVID-19 pandemic. Meanwhile, our district staff has been hard at work preparing to shift to Distance Learning while still preparing and delivering meals to students in our community.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: At the April 8, 2020, Stanfield School District Board of Directors meeting, the 2020-2021 school calendar was approved. Due to construction projects, we will start school AFTER Labor Day. Also please note the new start time.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: Please use the link below to place your child on the class roster for Kindergarten or for the 3-year-old Kindergarten Transition Program or 4-year-old Kindergarten Transition Program. This registration is for placement only. Required registration paperwork, birth certificate, shot record, and address verification will be required before school entry in the Fall of 2020. If you do not have your child's birth certificate please order before the fall registration. Fall registration date and time to be announced at a later date.

div.p: On Wednesday, April 8, 2020, Stanfield School District received three (3) qualified bids for asbestos abatement. The apparent low bidder is All-Safe Abatement Services. We appreciate the time and attention of all who responded to our proposal.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: On March 30th, Oregon Department of Education (ODE) released the “Distance Learning for All” guidance as part of the state’s plan to help districts in the event that we do not resume school in our buildings again this year. The guidance read, “we also foresee the strong possibility that our students may not come back through our school house doors this academic year.” Because of this, we are making a shift in efforts to carry us through the rest of the school year.
